name: Residenza Vespucci

reviews.text: A very nice and comfortable place. We came with two teenage kids and we had the three bedroom, two bathroom suite (the third bedroom was locked since we did not need it). The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were large and very nice. There is a central living room with internet access which we were allowed to use. The kitchen is usually locked but if you ask for something they are always happy to help. The hotel location is just perfect, right by the river and within walking distance to all major attractions in Florence. Francesco made us feel at ease and gave us advice on where to eat, etc. You will not find a better host. During our 2+ week stay in Italy we visited Como, Venice, Florence, Sorrento, and Rome - we enjoyed Florence the best. Make sure you see Michelangelo's David!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: We loved our room with our balcony overlooking the Arno. What a sweet place! The breakfasts were good ( We are addicted to Nutella now) and Francesco was very helpful. The ppl of Firenze are beautiful and friendly! Everything was within walking distance. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: On the Arno

reviews.text: We stayed in the Lungarno Suites in the Residenza Vespucci and thought it was absolutely fantastic. The views over the river are amazing: the main living room area has double doors and shutters that fold back to reveal a spectacular cityscape. What a treat!
reviews.title: Beautiful view and fabulous apartment

likes.liked: — Location, view, friendly service, value for money
likes.disliked: — Some night noise - not really a problem though - just take ear plugs!

reviews.text: The apartment consists of 3 double bedrooms (one ensuite), with a central living area (complete with sofas, table and chairs and a piano!) and a further bathroom. Each room is spacious and elegant, not too chichi but perfectly beautiful and stylish nonetheless.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

likes.liked: — Fabulous location / bathtubs / Very hospitable host

reviews.title: small hotel with big rooms
reviews.text: The high-ceilinged apartment itself was spotless, and the bathrooms were modern and clean, with all the accessories you would expect from a good hotel. Moreover, the showers are excellent - plenty of hot water and good pressure, if you like that sort of thing.
a clean simple b&b with aircon and a fridge in the room
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the people that run it are really helpful
reviews.title: Amazing place for an amazing price!

reviews.text: breakfast is included in the price and is more than adequate
reviews.title: Fantastic Apartment

reviews.text: and the location is fantastic - very central
reviews.title: Great hotel in Florence: Residenza Vespucci

likes.liked: — The helpfulness and friendliness of Francesco (hotel owner).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you drive there take a vallium because there are loads of one way streets around this area, but once you get there they will arrange for the carparking garage to pick up your car and park it for you and also to deliver it back (alternatively park at the central station car park - only 5 mins away)
reviews.title: On The Arno River

reviews.text: The Residenza is a very nice B&B, worthy of all the good reviews it's been getting on tripadvisor. We stayed in suite ognissanti (family with adolescent kids) and we liked it a lot. Francesco is a very nice fellow, the breakfast is very nice (home made), the rooms are big and clean the bathrooms are HUGE, the bed linen were embroidered(!) and in general we felt we were in a luxurious suite. The location is bang in the centre. The service is top rated and in general everything is very convenient and comfortable. Go there and you will see!
reviews.title: An unforgettable stay in Firenze

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the minus side, traffic noise does exist, but it did not bother us too much. There were quite a few passages of ambulances, but these are beyond anybody's control!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would give this B&B a 6 out of 5 if tripadvisor allows me to do so. My girlfriend and I stayed at Residenza Vespucci during our stay in Florence for four nights at the end of April 2009. As indicated in my heading, it was Excellent! Francisco, the owner of this B&B made us feel just like home. He helped us made reservation to the Uffizi Gallery and also recommended us to a local restaurant – Ostaria dei Centopoveri (just 5 minutes from B&B) which was by far the best restaurant we have visited in Florence (with a very reasonable price). There is a notebook (with internet access) in the common area which you can use 24-hours a day free of charge and if you have brought a notebook with you, there is also free wifi access. Breakfast was also excellent with a wide selection – cornflakes, croissants, bread (with toaster), cheese, salami, ham, etc. My girlfriend and I were happy when we saw scramble eggs on the breakfast table which was not offered by the other hotels that we stayed in Italy. The location is centrally located in Florence. 8 minutes walk (10 minutes with luggage) to Central Train Station, 4 minutes to Uffizi and 8 minutes to Duomo. The rooms were nice, big and clean. We stayed in the standard room for the first night and Francisco was kind enough to upgrade us to the Suite for the next three nights which included a nice living room facing the river. When reading some of the previous reviews on this particular website, I was a bit concerned about the noise level but it wasn’t really that bad and is certainly something that me and my girlfriend can live with.
reviews.title: the best place I have stayed at in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: highly recommended - we had a huge room with an equally HUGE bathroom with a double bath, a marble vanity etc - you could dance inside. The little corridor leading to the room had a beautiful marble framed mirror and two antique chairs to relax on...a few grand little touches like free lollies in the corridor makes your stay very pleasant. And did I mention the breakfast? Very nice. The service was good too, people were really nice and very attentive, asked what we would like for breakfast, told us all about the sites and gave us a free map. Overall - a great place!
reviews.title: Very nice B&B

reviews.text: Very nice B&B , good price/quality. We had a nice journey at Firenze.
reviews.title: Great Location and Hospitality

likes.liked: — The space and accessability to main attractions.

reviews.text: I read about Francesco and the Residenza on Trip Advisor's site, Five members of my family were traveling to Florence to join our daughter who was finishing a semester abroad, so the 3 bedroom suite was perfect! My sister arrived early - Francesco immediately invited her to stay by herself in the suite until we arrived. He allowed my daughter to store her semester's luggage there while we traveled for a week in Switzerland. The appointments were beautiful, bathrooms luxurious, breakfasts bountiful, and the location on the Arno River very convenient. The one bedroom suite has a view of the river. My only issue was street noise - I'm a light sleeper. Take ear plugs and you will be fine. There is no better place to stay for the price. I will always stay with Francesco when in Florence!
reviews.title: What a terrific find in Florence

reviews.text: Five of us stayed for a long weekend in the Langarno suit which had three bedrooms with two bathrooms, one on-suite. There was a very large sitting room with an amazing view over the River Arno and the Ponte Vecchio. The apartment was in a really wonderful position just a few minutes from all the main sights in Florence. Being on the road next to the river meant it did have traffic noise at night so take ear plugs. We had amazing food at a couple of restaurants a few minutes away, the Gobi 13 and the Marione. Overall, we had a really wonderful time in an amazing city the whole experience being made by this good quality apartment in a great position.
reviews.title: Wonderful Position

reviews.text: I have now stayed in this beautiful B&B five times, I have tried four different bedrooms, and every time, every bedroom has been a wonderful experience. Residenza Vespucci is located in the heart of Florence, a few minutes walk from Santa Maria Novella Station, from the shopping area, and from the historical sites. It is located on the Arno river, which gives it a very romantic vibe and it is not only surrounded by history, but also by nice restaurants, bars and clubs, so that you can easily reach everything you want to experience in Florence. The B&B is beautifully decorated, every room and every detail has a distinctive and elegant touch; you will see paintings on the walls, nice rugs, statues and a piano (in the Suite Arno). There is internet available everywhere (wireless) and in the reception area. Every room has its own mini fridge with few free drinks inside. My favorite suite is "Diamante", which I would advise you to book quite in advance considering its popularity. It has its own private living room with a fireplace, a couch, a sofa and a table. The bedroom is nice and so it' s the bathroom. The whole suite has balconies with a stunning view of the Arno which makes it ideal if you are looking for a romantic treat or simply want even more privacy. The breakfast is nice and abundant and the B&B is always very clean. The host, Francesco, is very kind and he always does the impossible to make sure my staying is extra comfortable (i.e. he would recommend and book restaurants for me or advice me on the best way to move around Florence). Residenza Vespucci has truly been a great experience for me and I would recommend to anyone. The history, the magic of the Arno, the comfort and elegance of the hotel, the warmth that you can breath everywhere will make your stay in Florence an incredible and unforgettable experience. It will feel just like being at home, at home in the heart of Florence.
reviews.title: What a great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've now stayed here twice this year and both times the place has been great! The thing I particularly like is that being apartments they offer something slightly different to the usual hotel experience. The rooms are excellently finished - rich fabrics, grand furniture and double height ceilings throughout. There are also some really nice details like those ornate radiators. Sounds like a minor point, but it all goes into making it feel like a really stylish place. The views are excellent, as is the location. Francesco is a great host and the breakfast is also good. Price-wise I think it compares favourably and I would have no hesitation in recommending this place.
reviews.title: Stylish apartments in the centre of Florence

reviews.text: I found this place by reading TripAdvisor reviews, at let me tell you, it was great. I have a huge room, with a amazing common room, which has a piano, the washroom has a shower, and a separate tub.
reviews.title: WOW, what a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Residenza Vespucci is in a great location (though it can be noisy), right by the Arno River and about 3 blocks from the Ponte Vecchio. It’s also only about a mile to the other major sites of Florence – the Uffizi Gallery and the Academia. If you stay here ask the hospitable Francesco to book the Gallery and Academia reservations for you in advance.
reviews.title: Great location, great host, just a great place!

likes.liked: — Clean, great location, good breakfast, great host (Francesco).
likes.disliked: — Bedroom may overlook a noisy street, smoking in common areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Residenza is broken up into suites and we had access to our extremely clean bedroom and a rather palatial bathroom. Our bedroom did not overlook the river but did overlook one of Florence’s noisy streets. The bed was very comfortable but as typical for me in noisy cities the first night I didn’t sleep very well. The second and third nights I slept very soundly. And on one evening the view out the window produced a parade of 10 Ferrari’s coming down the street for an event. That’s something you don’t see everyday!
reviews.title: Amazing
Loved it!
reviews.text: Breakfast was a step-above-the-usual with a variety of pastries, cereal, yogurts, and coffee types (fancy cappuccino being among the offerings). On our last day when more guests were in-house there were even some freshly made hard-boiled eggs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An item of note – I do not know if the Residenza Vespucci is supposed to be completely non-smoking. If you’re non-smokers (we are) there are people (staff?) that do smoke in the Residenza’s personal living spaces and common areas. They never smoked near our suite and with our section closed off the air was fine. It was only when we’d walk in the front door that odor was noticeable and smoking sometimes visible.
reviews.title: Brilliant Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even with the above smoking quibble we’d stay there again as we liked the location, property cleanliness, and hospitality of Francesco. We have already recommended this B&B to some other travelers.
reviews.title: Space, luxury, and a warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Francesco, please forgive us. We meant to write a review when we returned to the states, but got busy. Of the hotels we stayed in Italy, this hotel was one of the nicesest. We enjoyed Francesco's hospitality and greatly appreciated how he made us feel at home. We stayed in the three bedroom suite with two baths. The rooms were very spacious, clean, and the bathrooms were quite large. We liked relaxing after a long day of sightseeing in the common area. At the hotel we also had an opportunity to use Francesco's lap top to make golf tee times, and research the area. Francesco was most helpful in secruing us times to see the "David", golf, and local wineries. His restaurant suggestions were also some of the best food we had on our trip--
reviews.title: Charm on the Arno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: without the tourists! The hotel was close to all local attractions, and since we rented a car, easy to make it to Chianti Road. The only concern we had was the rooms were off a busy road, and a little more sound proofing is needed for the windows to block the noise--but the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Great hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Unique boutique b&b on the Arno

reviews.text: The warmth of the reception was very remarkable. You will not find a better host than Francesco. He gave us good information, made restaurant reservations, and gave us snacks during our stay. He takes pride in his small hotel. We were 2 married couples and stayed in the 3 bedroom, 2 bath suite. There was a small sitting area. The bathrooms were very large with heated towel bars. Everything was very clean and comfortable. There was a safe in the room and a very pleasant breakfast. The location is great, near the train station, but on the river, and near attractions. You are allowed to use his computer for checking home. I would absolutely return again and have recommended this inn to people several times.
reviews.title: Great Arno River View!

reviews.text: We traveled with 2 children and I must say that the apartment is in a brilliant location. we were able to get round all the sites and visit some lovely ice cream parlors. The children loved it. The apartment is very large and clean the owners are lovely and very helpful. It was easy to travel round as we were 15min from the main train station, we went to Rome and Pisa on day trips I purchased the ticket for the train before we left, we had a fantastic time.
reviews.title: Great Great Great

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May, travelling with my husband and 2 young children aged 2 1/2 and 4. This B&B does have a lift which was great for us as we had the buggy, luggage and 2 kids in tow!
reviews.title: Great B&B - highly recommended!

reviews.text: Michael (owner) and son Francesco are very welcoming and were happy to recommend local restaurants which were reasonable priced. They are also willing to help you book tickets to get into the museums and art galleries, and to recommend places of interest.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was on the first floor next to the office which consisted of a double bedroom, living room, connecting balcony and shower room. The view was amazing as you are overlooking the River Arno and the beautiful buildings, bridges and horizon. The kids were on pullout beds in the living room and we left the connecting door open to keep an eye on them. They loved the space and looking out on the balcony. Every time my son saw someone rowing he would start singing row, row, row your boat!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Victoria is the housekeeper and makes the breakfast. There is a wide selection consisting of cereals, bread, cheeses, ham, eggs, fruits, juices, yoghurts. She can also cook a hot breakfast and made us scrambled eggs with bacon every morning and a strong Italian coffee. The kids loved spreading Nutella on toast and getting it everywhere!
reviews.title: Beautiful!

description: Residenza Vespucci is right on the banks of the Arno River, a 5-minute walk from the Ponte Vecchio. You will have great views, friendly service and free Wi-Fi.The Vespucci is less than half a mile from the Duomo and close to streets full of antique shops. All of Florence's sights are within walking distance of the property.Rooms at Residenza Vespucci are spacious and very clean. They have air conditioning, minibars and irons. Some face the Arno River and Ponte Vecchio Bridge from their balcony with table and chairs.A rich continental breakfast includes a wide choice of products. It is served at a cafe set on the ground floor of the same building right outside the main entrance.The staff at the front desk will give you a city map, and can provide you with tips on the best restaurants, shops and museums.
